stickypolicy

Class ServiceProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • stickypolicy.ServiceProvider

  • public class ServiceProvider
extends java.lang.Object
    This class simulates a ServiceProvider with a database to store user data

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ServiceProvider()
      Class contructor which initializes database but does not initialize server and client

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static StickyHeader accessData(int accessHash)
      If the data is present in the databse, returns the first UserData object that matches the given hash and notifies client of access.
      static UserData copyData(UserData data)
      Returns a single copy of a UserData object
      static int deleteData(int delHash)
      Deletes all UserData objects with the given hash by changing the valid value associated with that data to false
      static void interpretMessage(Message msg)
      Interprets a Messages recieved from a User.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main method for running ServiceProvider.
      static java.lang.String printDatabase()
      Returns a String representation of the current contents of the database
      static void startServers(int serverPort, java.lang.String address, int clientPort)
      Creates and starts the ServiceProvider's server and client
      static void storeData(UserData data, int copies)
      Adds a UserData object to the database with specified number of copies

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServiceProvider

        public ServiceProvider()
        Class contructor which initializes database but does not initialize server and client

    • Method Detail

      • startServers

        public static void startServers(int serverPort,
                                java.lang.String address,
                                int clientPort)
        Creates and starts the ServiceProvider's server and client
        Parameters:
        serverPort - The port number for the server to connect to
        address - The IP address for the client to connect to
        clientPort - The port number for the client to connect to

      • copyData

        public static UserData copyData(UserData data)
        Returns a single copy of a UserData object
        Parameters:
        data - A UserData object to copy
        Returns:
        A UserData object with the same sticky header and hash as the input

      • storeData

        public static void storeData(UserData data,
                             int copies)
        Adds a UserData object to the database with specified number of copies
        Parameters:
        data - A UserData object to store in the database
        copies - The number of copies of the UserData to create and store

      • deleteData

        public static int deleteData(int delHash)
        Deletes all UserData objects with the given hash by changing the valid value associated with that data to false
        Parameters:
        delHash - The hash of the data to be deleted
        Returns:
        The number of data found and deleted

      • accessData

        public static StickyHeader accessData(int accessHash)
        If the data is present in the databse, returns the first UserData object that matches the given hash and notifies client of access. Otherwise returns null
        Parameters:
        accessHash - The hash of the UserData to be accessed
        Returns:
        The UserData that matches the given hash, or null if no such UserData can be found or is invalid

      • interpretMessage

        public static void interpretMessage(Message msg)
        Interprets a Messages recieved from a User. If the Message is an UPLOAD, two copies of the recieved data are made and all three pieces of data are stored. If the Message is a DELETE, the data related to the hash stored in the Message is deleted and an ACKNOWLEDGE message is sent to the User
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to be interpreted

      • printDatabase

        public static java.lang.String printDatabase()
        Returns a String representation of the current contents of the database
        Returns:
        A String representation of the current contents of the database

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method for running ServiceProvider. Creates a new ServiceProvider and starts the server and client with arguments provided
        Parameters:
        args - [server port number] [client address] [client port number]
